entrydata.text: SSLTC submitted the sourcing request on September 07, 2022 for the new solicitation and the new RFP was posted on November 30, 2022. However, the vendor attempting to bid has a lot of questions about the pricing form. To address the vendorâ€™s questions, the closing date for the RFQ was extended to January 25th to allow the vendors more time to place a proper bid. Given the complexity of the pricing form (Over 600 items) we would like enough time to review all bids submitted before going out for BAP and having a contract awarded. We anticipate this will happen before the expiration of the current contract which is set to expire February 28th, 2023. A bridging contract is needed to avoid service interruption.
